com.topcoder.search.builder.ldap
Class LDAPSearchStrategy

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.search.builder.ldap.LDAPSearchStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
SearchStrategy
public class LDAPSearchStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements SearchStrategy

This is a Search Strategy that is tuned for searching an LDAP data store. It is responsible for building the necessary LDAP search string appropriate to the filters provided and executing the search string on the LDAP server. This is done with the help of the SearchFragmentBuilder implementations that are provided in this package.

Each SearchFragmentBuilder is responsible for building the LDAP search string fragment for a specific filter, and a ClassAssociator is used to associate the FragmentBuilders with the filters.

The LDAPConnectionInformation from the previous version is used to connect to the LDAP server. It uses the Topcoder LDAP SDK to establish and manage the connections. Since 1.3, the connection to the LDAP server is not cached.

Thread Safety: - This is thread safe. The state is maintained in a separate SearchContext class, allowing concurrent calls to be supported.

Version:
1.3
Author:
ShindouHikaru, TCSDEVELOPER

Constructor Detail

LDAPSearchStrategy

public LDAPSearchStrategy(LDAPConnectionInformation connectionInfo,
                          java.util.Map associations)

Create a new instance.

The valid keys for fragmentBuilders are non-null Filters or Class objects. The valid values for fragmentBuilders are non-null SearchFragmentBuilder objects. The Map is used to populate searchFragmentBuidlers ClassAssociator.

Parameters:
connectionInfo - a ConnectionInformation object
associations - A map of filter to SearchFragmentBuilder mappings. The SearchFragmentBuilders should be SQL-database oriented to be useful in this component.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is Null, or if associations contains invalid values.

public LDAPSearchStrategy(java.lang.String namespace)

Parameters:

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if namespace is null or an empty (trimmed) String.
SearchBuilderConfigurationException - if a configuration property that is required is not found, or if a configuration property does not make sense.

search

public java.lang.Object search(java.lang.String context,
                               Filter filter,
                               java.util.List returnFields,
                               java.util.Map aliasMap)
                        throws PersistenceOperationException,
                               UnrecognizedFilterException

Search LDAP directory and return specified fields.

Parameter Range: None-Null , None_empty. Each element in fields parameter should not be null and should not be empty. The fields parameter contains a List of Strings specifying the fields should be returned.

Specified by:
search in interface SearchStrategy
Parameters:
context - a search string used to conduct the search
filter - The filter that is used to constrain the search.
returnFields - names of fields should be returned
aliasMap - a map of strings, holding the alternate names of fields as keys and their actual values in the datastore as the respective values.
Returns:
an Iterator of Entry objects holding search result
Throws:
PersistenceOperationException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is Null, or if aliasMap contains non-String or null or empty String elements. or if any paramter is empty or any element in the fields parameter is empty
PersistenceOperationException - if any error when operating over data store
UnrecognizedFilterException - if an appropriate SearchFragmentHandler cannot be found for a filter.

buildSearchContext

protected SearchContext buildSearchContext(java.lang.String context,
                                           Filter filter,
                                           java.util.List returnFields,
                                           java.util.Map aliasMap)
                                    throws UnrecognizedFilterException

This is used to build the search context to be used when executing the search. In this Strategy, the SearchContext that is build will simply contain the LDAP search String to use - parameter binding is not supported because it is not explicitly needed.

This relies on the implementations of SearchFragmentBuilder to support the building of the search string. Each implementation is expected to read in the contents of a Filter and build the appropriate LDAP search string fragment according to that filter. This fragment is then appended to the SearchContext that is being used.

The end-product would be a SearchContext that contains the LDAP search String reflecting the Filter constraints.

Parameters:
context - a search string used to conduct the search
filter - The filter that is used to constrain the search.
returnFields - A list of fields that should be returned by the strategy.
aliasMap - a map of strings, holding the alternate names of fields as keys and their actual values in the datastore as the respective values.
Returns:
A SearchContext object that is used to hold the state of building the search.
Throws:
UnrecognizedFilterException - if an appropriate SearchFragmentHandler cannot be found for a filter.

connect

protected com.topcoder.util.net.ldap.sdkinterface.LDAPSDKConnection connect()
                                                                     throws PersistenceOperationException

Creates a connection to the LDAP server.

Returns:
An open connection to the LDAP server.
Throws:
PersistenceOperationException - if any error when get the connection
